result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J West was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
DOC COLLECT
Obtain or maintain at least part time employment as determined appropriate by the agent and / or medical professionals.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Attend all medical and metal health appointments and take all medications as prescribed. 
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

No violent contact with R.L.W.
No contact with J.R.K., J.M.S., and N.M.J.B., other than incidental. 
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physicians order. No bars, taverns or liquor stores.

Defendant in court in custody via video with atty Jeremiah Maynard. DDA Sempf appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant agrees proceed via video for Plea. Guilty plea count #1; count #2 dismissed and read in. PSI ordered. Minutes filed.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Timothy J West appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jerimiah Maynard in court for Timothy J West.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:32 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22cm208, and status conferences on 20CF563 and 22CF170. Record by Atty. Maynard as to initial appearance on CM file. He has gone over the charges and penalties, waives further reading, and enters not guilty pleas on behalf of his client. All matters set out for further status in about 2 weeks. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:03 PM (64-06) Defendant Timothy J West appeared by video.  Attorney Jeramiah Maynard in court for Timothy J West.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court called to the stand as a witness, Michael Sulzer from the Delevan Police Dept. 
Michael Sulzer duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Herrmann. Witness has identified the defendant in the court on the video. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
2:06 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Maynard.
 
2:08 PM - Argument by the State.
2:08 PM - Defense forgoes argument at this time.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges.
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Maynard acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading plead not guilty to the charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy Trial Reserved.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy J West in court, in custody by video.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Timothy J West. Reading of complaint waived. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Rights given and hearing requested, within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.

BOND TO COVER 22GF285 & 20CF563

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.R.K., J.M.S., N.M.J.B., OR R.L.W. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-1379, 22-1380 & 22-1381
